full_summary:
**Government of Canada Tender Announcement**
Designated Substance and Hazardous Materials Identification Services
================ nutritious (GSC will not finalize this latter link for compilation) ====
-----------------------------------------------------
### Official Solicitation Details
* **Solicitation Number**: QUMATD24_81709
* **Solicitation Title**: Designated Substance and Hazardous Materials Identification services
* **Deadline for Submission**: 2024-05-06 14:00:00
* **Notice Type**: Not specified (open bidding)
* **Trade Agreements**: Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA)

### Brief Description of the Tender:
The Government of Canada, through Defence Construction Canada (DCC), invites consultants with expertise in designated substance and hazardous materials identification to submit their proposals for a Standing Offer Agreement (SOA) to provide as-needed professional services in the Quebec region.
The services include locating designated substances, characterizing materials, inventorying designated substances in buildings, and providing recommendations for handling and disposal.

The selected consultant will be required to hold a valid Designated Organization Screening (DOS) from the Contract Security Program (CSP) of Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC). Details on security requirements are outlined in the Request for Proposal (RFP) documents.

The Standing Offer Agreement will be for a period of one (1) year with a maximum value of $335,000.00. The agreement may be extended for up to three (3) additional one-year periods and increased by up to $335,000.00 at the discretion of DCC.

### Interested Parties
Societies with the required expertise are invited to submit their abbreviated proposals through the MERX Electronic Bidding System by the closing date and time.

### Important Notes
* The selected consultant will be required to hold a valid Designated Organization Screening (DOS) from the Contract Security Program (CSP) of Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC).
* The Request for Proposal (RFP) documents, including security requirements, are available on the MERX Electronic Bidding System.
* Questions regarding this solicitation should be directed to the point of contact listed in this announcement only. Please do not contact any other person or entity during the solicitation period. You may, however, submit questions to the point of contact.

### Access to Bidding Documents
You can submit an offer and access the documents on http://
